intro: Desmos tiebaghiensis, commonly known as the Tioga desmos, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture.
